turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Hello. I am glad you are joining me here for this important task.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Hi Thanks

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: You're welcome. I am glad they assigned us this task because it has the potential to help children. Do you consider yourself an empathetic person normally?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yes. I am an empathetic person because I have children myself.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Oh that is good! I also have children. I have three girls. You? (I won't ask for any personal details - I promise.)

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I have a son and a daughter. Both are adults now but it seems like yesterday they were younger.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Ahh, yes I know what you mean. My oldest will be 21 next week, and the youngers ones are in their late teenage years. It goes by so quickly!

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yes it does! My daughter is 19 and she is still living with us. Going to school for nursing. My son is 26 and lives with us because he is autistic and non-verbal.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: My husband has a little brother who has Asperger's. Not nearly the level of autism of your son, but I do have empathy for you.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Oh thank you so much. Me and my husband are very grateful that he is not as severe as some. He can pretty much understand everything you are saying and he can do many things for himself like eating, bathing, washing his clothes and many other things. It's just that the speech is not there. He started at 2 yrs. but it never developed.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: It must be very hard, and also at the same time very rewarding, taking care of a child with special needs.  It is interesting that your daughter is going to school for nursing. Do you think that it's because she has spent her life watching (and I'd assume participating in the) care of her brother?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yes, that is exactly what she said was the reason she got into nursing! She has been his right hand since she was born. She knows more about him than i do. :)

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Wow! You must be very proud of her!

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yes I am. I know you are proud of your daughters. What is your daughter going to college to do?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: She graduated with a degree in Interior Design. She has been a designer since she was about 3 years old! LOL  My other girls, though, have no idea what they like, except that they all like taking care of children (all work in day care or nanny jobs).

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: That awesome! I always admire people who can visualize what is stylish for a room. I don't know a thing about decorating! And your other two sound like very compassionate and caring young ladies. You have to be to take care of little ones!

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I am with you there! I have absolutely zero flair for style. But my daughter has always been able to put things together so well. I honestly don't know where she got it from! But, I am happy that at least someone in the family can make us look good. Haha  And yes, they are all so good with little ones. It does make me feel good to see that. I feel like I must have done some good things right as a mom, if they like kids so much!

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yes indeed! Some people are not as fortunate to have parents such as us. But I think that I did pretty good myself! My son did learn some living skills and learning more and my daughter is in school.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I am sure you have done a great job with both of your kids! It sounds like they are very special!  I didn't design it this way, but I am glad that we talked about our kids so much. Are you familiar with a charity called Save the Children? I am to ask you if you would please donate all or part of the small stipend that we make for this discussion to that charity tonight.  Would you do that?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yes I am familiar and I sure will. I can donate $1 if that is all right.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes, absolutely, $1 would be a lovely donation.  That will be deducted directly from your payment. Is that okay with you?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yes that is fine. I love to be a part of helping a child in need.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes, as do I. I am grateful that there are people like you out there.  I am also very happy that your daughter will be in the nursing profession. It sounds like she comes from a good family!

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Thank you! You sound like you have a lovely family also!! It was so nice to chat with you. I wish you and your family the best.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Thank you for your $1 donation, and for your time and conversation. :)

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Take care and thank you!
